title: Matchsafe, ""J. Palmer's Royal Patent Wax Vesta Match"", 1848
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: Rectangular, curved corners, canted sides, with cover that slides off top of box; cover features beading on right and left edges, with thumb catch on right side, raised frame contains inscription "J. Palmer's, Camberwell London"; inscription inside frame reads "Royal Patent, Wax Vesta Match"; at center is small raised opening to hold single lit match, to left is image of lion, over opening is crown, to right is image of a horse; underside inscribed "Alexander S. Stocker, Patentee" in upper recessed area, striker in central recess, "Brass Battery Works, Wandsworth Surrey" inscribed in bottom recess.

exhibitions.title: Faster, Cheaper, Newer, More: The Revolutions of 1848

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, ""J. Palmer's Royal Patent Wax Vesta Match"", 1848.
1848. Gilded brass. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1980-14-1309.
